1.name: Sylvan Wood
1.desc: The most basic type of wood which can be found everywhere across all kingdoms. Used for crafting simple and makeshift tools.

2.name: Birch Wood
2.desc: Known for its durability and natural resistance to decay. Used for crafting items that require a bit more resilience.

3.name: Ironbark Wood
3.desc: Among the toughest hardwoods, it is extremely dense and impervious, with a nearly unbreakable outer bark.

4.name: Heartcore Wood
4.desc: The mystical essence derived from the most ancient of treants.

5.name: Enchanted Wood
5.desc: Almost forgotten mythical wood from the Elder Tree that predate civilization.

6.name: Rough Stone
6.desc: Small stone pieces commonly found along riverbanks and paths.

7.name: Marker Stone
7.desc: Upright stones marking paths and boundaries since ancient times.

8.name: Stream Fish
8.desc: Small, bountiful fish teeming in babbling streams and rivers.

9.name: Marsh Fish
9.desc: Robust, hardy fish scavenged from stagnant marsh waters.

10.name: Iron Ore
10.desc: A common ferrous ore that can be smelted into useful iron metals.

11.name: Copper Ore
11.desc: Reddish-brown ore that yields a soft, conductive copper metal.

12.name: Common Wheat
12.desc: Common wheat varieties grown on farms and in fields.

13.name: Hearty Wheat
13.desc: Extra healthy, disease-resistant wheat with a slightly nutty flavor.

14.name: Wild Berries
14.desc: Basic, tangled handfuls of assorted common berries from the wild.

15.name: Bramble Berries
15.desc: Larger hauls of berries plucked from thick brambles.

16.name: Snow Fur
16.desc: Prized for its natural warmth and durability.

17.name: Sharp Claw
17.desc: The natural weapon of natural predators.

18.name: Sticky Mucus
18.desc: A valuable crafting material. Use it to create various items and enhance your abilities in the game.

19.name: Bat Wings
19.desc: The black wings of night creatures, but this is the small variant from a small creature.

20.name: Tattered Cloth
20.desc: Scraps of fabric that can be used for crafting or repairs.

21.name: Beginner Wood Axe
21.desc: A small and old wood axe used for chopping some common logs.

22.name: Novice Wood Axe
22.desc: A heavy wood axe, but prone to break.

23.name: Beginner Hammer
23.desc: Starter stone hammer with a balanced, light head for easy handling.

24.name: Novice Hammer
24.desc: Enhanced stone hammer which is designed for longer use with less fatigue.

25.name: Beginner Fishing Rod
25.desc: Simple design, perfect for catching small fish.

26.name: Novice Fishing Rod
26.desc: A balanced blend of durability and flexibility, made for catching small-to-medium fish.

27.name: Beginner Pickaxe
27.desc: A dull and old pickaxe for common ores and minerals.

28.name: Novice Pickaxe
28.desc: A standard pickaxe used by miners throughout the four Kingdoms.

29.name: Beginner Sickle
29.desc: A rusty sickle, only capable of harvesting the most basic wheat.

30.name: Novice Sickle
30.desc: Balanced and lightweight with better grip for efficient wheat cutting.

31.name: Beginner Berry Shears
31.desc: Gentle on berries, ideal for beginners learning to forage.

32.name: Novice Berry Shears
32.desc: Improved design for quick and easy collection of medium-sized berries.

33.name: Rusty Sword
33.desc: An old sword that was left to rust. It's visibly deteriorating, but it's still better than your fists.

34.name: Iron Sword
34.desc: Balanced for quick strikes, with an iron composition for durability.

35.name: Composite Bow
35.desc: An old and dusty bow that's only good at hitting small creatures.

36.name: Hunting Bow
36.desc: A basic hunting bow - plain, yet versatile.

37.name: Warrior's Longsword
37.desc: A finely-crafted longsword wielded by warriors. Its razor-sharp edge and balanced weight make it a reliable weapon against moderately powerful foes.

38.name: Hand Axe
38.desc: A simple one-handed axe, favored by woodcutters, but can be used as a weapon in dire need.

39.name: War Axe
39.desc: A brutal axe designed for combat.

40.name: Footman's Spear
40.desc: A basic spear issued to foot soldiers. Its sturdy sylvan wood shaft and leaf-shaped spearhead are surprisingly reliable.

41.name: Honed Longspear
41.desc: A well-crafted longspear with a sharp steel head. Its extended reach make it formidable against any type of enemies.

42.name: Sylvan Branch
42.desc: A very simple staff carved from Sylvanwood, hence the namesake.

43.name: Greatstaff
43.desc: An imposing staff no shorter than the height of an elephant.

44.name: Bandit's Shank
44.desc: A crudely-fashioned dagger, favored by highway bandits and cutpurses.

45.name: Sharp Dagger
45.desc: A fine dagger with a slender, razor blade. Lightweight and easily concealed.

46.name: Poor Man's Shield
46.desc: A busted old shield that seems to come from a far away place, beyond the Outer World.

47.name: Buckler
47.desc: A sturdy steel shield, reinforced with additional metal braces along the edges.

48.name: Wool Robes
48.desc: A simple robe fashioned from thick wool.

49.name: Padded Coat
49.desc: A long, quilted coat with internal padding. Deceptively lightweight.

50.name: Peasant's Cap
50.desc: A simple, shapeless cap made of rough fabric.

51.name: Knitted Cowl
51.desc: A close-fitting cowl knitted from sturdy wool yarn.

52.name: Worn Sandals
52.desc: Crude everyday sandals, the straps frayed from much use.

53.name: Common Travelling Boots
53.desc: Sturdy boots with thick soles, designed for long journeys on foot.

54.name: Leather Cloak
54.desc: A cloak fashioned from layers of toughened leather and fabrics.

55.name: Hardened Cloak
55.desc: A full cloak of boiled and hardened leather.

56.name: Basic Hide Hat
56.desc: A simple hat crafted from a single piece of cured leather.

57.name: Leather Helmet
57.desc: A sturdy helmet covered in overlapping rows of leather.

58.name: Old Boots
58.desc: Well-worn leather boots, the material cracked and scuffed from years of use.

59.name: Leather Shoes
59.desc: Ankle-high shoes crafted from boiled and hardened leather.

60.name: Crude Chest Armor
60.desc: A simple sleeveless plate vest crafted from iron. This crude armor offers decent protection against blows.

61.name: Basic Plate Armor
61.desc: A full suit of sturdy iron plates, solidly riveted together.

62.name: Iron Helm
62.desc: A simple iron helmet with a face guard for extra protection.

63.name: Great Helm
63.desc: A heavy iron helmet with a cylindrical visor and hinged ventail. The fully enclosed design offers good protection.

64.name: Crude Iron Boots
64.desc: Basic iron plate coverings for the feet.

65.name: Fluted Greaves
65.desc: Ornately fluted and articulated iron plates that cover the entire lower leg.

66.name: Small Healing Potion
66.desc: A small potion that restores a small amount of health. Ideal for quick recovery during early adventures.

67.name: Draconic Heart
67.desc: It is said that a dragon's soul persists in its heart after death. The heart is still pulsing, albeit faintly.

68.name: Red Scales
68.desc: Crimson dragon scales, said to be nigh-indestructible, and of course, incredibly valuable.

69.name: Dragon Fang
69.desc: A massive and sharp fang, imbued with the dragon's ferocity.

70.name: Beast Piercer
70.desc: A vicious piercing spear edged with a dragon's lethal fang.

71.name: Blood Armor
71.desc: An imposing armor, made with the essence of a dragon's ethereal heart. The heart's power turns the iron plate blood red, hence the namesake.

72.name: Scaled Greatshield
72.desc: A towering shield adorned with dragon scales, providing effective defense.

73.name: Stormwood
73.desc: A sturdy, tempest-touched wood that grows in regions of constant lightning and thunder.

74.name: Bloodoak
74.desc: Named for its dark red sap, which flows like blood when the tree is cut.

75.name: Starwood
75.desc: A pale and luminous wood that glows softly in the dark, as if imbued with the light of distant stars.

76.name: Phoenix Wood
76.desc: Extremely lightweight yet almost unbreakable. Even after being severely damaged, Phoenix Wood will gradually restore itself, much like the mythical phoenix rising from its ashes.

77.name: Yggdrasil Wood
77.desc: This wood is said to be connected to the life force of all living things, making it extremely rare and powerful.

78.name: Flintrock
78.desc: A sharp-edged stone favored for crafting primitive tools and weapons with a rugged appearance.

79.name: Ironstone
79.desc: A dense, metallic stone often used for basic armor and weapon crafting. Its durability makes it ideal for medium-level smiths.

80.name: Graniteheart
80.desc: A tough stone known for its resilience, used in fortifying structures and crafting sturdy equipment.

81.name: Basaltcore
81.desc: Formed in volcanic regions, this stone has excellent heat-resistant properties.

82.name: Thunderstone
82.desc: A vibrating stone that holds traces of thunderous energy.

83.name: Mythrilstone
83.desc: A lightweight, shimmering stone with extraordinary strength, ideal for crafting high-tier, agile armor and weapons.

84.name: Lavaheart
84.desc: This stone emanates the intense energy of volcanic eruptions, and its core can unleash a burst of flame to ignite nearby beings.

85.name: Celestialite
85.desc: An ultra-rare stone found only in the deepest parts of the universe, its energy is said to warp time and space.

86.name: Bluegill
86.desc: A modest-sized fish with a blue tint. It is known for its mild flavor and is often used in simple cooking recipes.

87.name: Golden Fish
87.desc: A rare variant of the trout with golden scales. It’s sought after for its unique flavor and is often used in special dishes and potions.

88.name: Piranha
88.desc: Fearsome predator known for its razor-sharp teeth and aggressive feeding behavior.

89.name: Demon Catfish
89.desc: Known for its eerie silence and stealthy movements, making it a formidable predator.

90.name: Moonlit Fish
90.desc: Has a shimmering, silver-blue body that reflects moonlight with an otherworldly glow.

91.name: Dragonfish
91.desc: Known for its formidable strength and fiery temperament, the Dragonfish can harness elemental fire and magical energies.

92.name: Void Octofish
92.desc: Possesses remarkable control over void and darkness. Its tentacles can manipulate shadows and create areas of darkness, making it difficult to approach.

93.name: Starlight Serpent
93.desc: A mythical fish that glows with starlight. It’s used in crafting legendary items that have the power to turn the tide of battle.

94.name: Nickel Ore
94.desc: A lustrous, silvery metal with a hint of gold. It is used in crafting stronger weapons and tools.

95.name: Emerald Ore
95.desc: A rare and valuable green gem that is used in crafting items with enhanced magical properties and higher durability.

96.name: Adamantite Ore
96.desc: An incredibly tough and rare metal, known for its durability and sharpness. Ideal for creating high-tier weapons and armor with exceptional qualities.

97.name: Mithril Ore
97.desc: A rare, lightweight metal highly sought after for its strength and magical conductivity.

98.name: Dark Ore
98.desc: A deep, glossy black mineral with subtle metallic flecks. Valued for its durability and strength.

99.name: Meteorite Ore
99.desc: Forged from the remnants of meteors, this dark, metallic ore boasts a rough texture and scattered celestial flecks.

100.name: Infinity Ore
100.desc: A mysterious mineral with an otherworldly radiance, derived from ancient stellar phenomena. Provides limitless potential for crafting powerful and unique magical items.

101.name: Celestial Ore
101.desc: A mythical ore with an exquisite lotus-shaped glow. Imbued with ancient cosmic energy.

102.name: Strawberry
102.desc: A juicy, sweet fruit with vibrant red skin and tiny seeds.

103.name: Mulberry
103.desc: A sweet, dark purple fruit with a delicate, juicy texture.

104.name: Verdant Grape
104.desc: A fresh green grape with a crisp texture, thriving in lush, sunlit vineyards.

105.name: Fireberry
105.desc: A bright, fiery red fruit with a flame-like appearance, thriving in warm, sunlit environments.

106.name: Radiant Goldberry
106.desc: Known for its dazzling golden color and glowing appearance, this berry flourishes in warm, sunny locales.

107.name: Stormberry
107.desc: A vibrant, stormy-colored fruit with a rugged texture, growing in tempestuous, storm-prone areas.

108.name: Permafrost Berry
108.desc: A striking, icy blue fruit with a chilled surface, growing in extreme cold climates.

109.name: Solar Berry
109.desc: A fiery red fruit with a smooth, radiant surface that thrives in extreme environments.

110.name: Robust Wheat
110.desc: Able to thrive in poor soil conditions, this hardy wheat produces plump, protein-rich kernels.

111.name: Golden Wheat
111.desc: Prized for its vibrant golden hue and sweet, buttery taste when milled into flour.

112.name: Rubyfield Wheat
112.desc: Deep ruby-red kernels give this rare wheat an earthy, almost wine-like essence when baked or brewed.

113.name: Amberwave Wheat
113.desc: Golden amber kernels imbue baked goods with a rich, honeyed aroma and flavor.

114.name: Wildbloom Wheat
114.desc: This delicately floral wheat variety adds subtle sweet notes of meadow blossoms.

115.name: Dewkissed Wheat
115.desc: Grown only in misty groves, the morning dew gives this wheat a crisp, rejuvenating freshness.

116.name: Seabathed Wheat
116.desc: Kernels that are ocean-cured to perfection impart a warm, refreshing sweet and salty flavour.

117.name: Starblossom Wheat
117.desc: The ultra-rare cosmic wheat reveals hints of far-off galaxies in its delicate, ethereal essence.

118.name: Common Healing Potion
118.desc: A reliable remedy that restores moderate health, found in most village apothecaries.

119.name: Hardwood Shell
119.desc: A piece of the Crabark's exoskeleton, made from a mixture of woods found in Sylvanreach.

120.name: Budding Horn
120.desc: This horn began to sprout from inside of a leafdrake, which typically bears no horn. Some kind of evolution?

121.name: Blue Leaf
121.desc: Petalflare's green leaves sometime turn blue in rare and unknown occasions.

122.name: Poisonous Fang
122.desc: The Basilisk has two types of fangs, this is the smaller, yet sharper and more dangerous one.

123.name: Overgrown Mushroom Cap
123.desc: This huge mushroom cap is strangely hot to the touch.

124.name: Frozen Claw
124.desc: The cold, icy claw of a predator in the mist. It's heavier than it looks.

125.name: Lizard Tail
125.desc: The blue tail of Snowzards can move independently from its main body after it's been chopped off.

126.name: Ghost Wings
126.desc: The transparent and ghost-like wings of a Glaciewyrm. They're cold to the touch, and melt into misty water if not properly kept.

127.name: Warm Fur
127.desc: The white fur of magnificent snow creatures roaming in the wilds of Everfrost.

128.name: Stinger
128.desc: The sharp and long sting of a huge insect. It can pierce cleanly through armor and shield with enough force.

129.name: Brimstone Horn
129.desc: A large horn burning with inner heat. Highly prized among blacksmiths across the Outer World.

130.name: Beastmen's Metal Piece
130.desc: The unusual metal of beastmen origin, blended from iron, copper, and other unknown types of ores.

131.name: Ritual Dagger
131.desc: Elegant dagger made of ancient ingredients, used primarily in sacrifices.

132.name: Assassin Dagger
132.desc: Lightweight yet lethal. The size of the sword does not matter when death is certain.

133.name: Steel Shield
133.desc: A well-made round shield on the smaller side, but very effective at deflecting attacks.

134.name: Knight's Greatshield
134.desc: Huge metal shield that's two times heavier than most standard weapons.

135.name: Ranger's Hood
135.desc: Typical adventurer's hood, unremarkable but very versatile.

136.name: Hood of the Astrologer
136.desc: Hood tailored from high quality fabrics. Worn by those who look to the great above.

137.name: Flower Sandals
137.desc: Light sandal made of natural leaves and vines that seem to elevate your every step.

138.name: Boots of the Pilgrim
138.desc: Very well made shoes without any exceptional features, crafted for travelling long distances. It's very good at what it does.

139.name: Noble's Robe
139.desc: Lightweight robe made from natural blue leaves that seems to elevate your every move.

140.name: Mist Monk's Robe
140.desc: Robe worn by a secret sect hidden deep in Misthaven, but has since spread across kingdoms.

141.name: Claymore
141.desc: A large sword with a long, straight blade. Surprisingly balanced and versatile for its size, this weapon is the golden standard in weapon smithing.

142.name: Sunforged Blade
142.desc: The Sun has many faces, and this sword was used in prayers long ago to see one.

143.name: Warchief's Axe
143.desc: Large axe commissioned for only the best of warriors. Misthaven's blacksmiths are very peculiar about the axes they make.

144.name: Mist Cleaver
144.desc: A sharp axe with long blades that're as sharp as a razor. It is said that this axe can cut through the mist of Misthaven itself.

145.name: The Needle
145.desc: A very light and thin spear, with a sharp black spearhead that can penetrate standard armor pieces.

146.name: Rocksplitter Lance
146.desc: This ultra long spear does not bend at all even under hard pressure, and thus very effective in combating huge beasts.

147.name: The Violet
147.desc: This elegant bow is unusually light and easy to handle, mainly because of the ethereal materials used in its creation. Used regularly by noblewomen.

148.name: Brimstone Bow
148.desc: A bow that's always warm to the touch. In the right situation it can even enflame the arrows.

149.name: Staff of Ice
149.desc: Covered in lizard scales on both ends, this cold staff can act both as a medium for sorceries and as an effective blunt weapon.

150.name: Scepter of the Frost Giants
150.desc: A very long staff with magical properties. Legends say the frost giants are the master of winter, and it is their primordial magic that keep Everfrost in an everlasting winter.

151.name: Foot Soldier's Tabard
151.desc: Leather padded cloth armor, worn by a kingdom's foot soldiers.

152.name: Coat of the White
152.desc: Huge coat of white fur that both insulate the wearer from Everfrost's cold nights, and thick enough to protect against slash strikes.

153.name: Fur Hood
153.desc: Hood of fur that covers the ears. Can be worn inside a plate helmet, if you need to fight in the dead of winter.

154.name: Howler Hood
154.desc: The hood helps hunters blend into the environment, ideal for tracking prey in the wild.

155.name: Warrior's Battle Boots
155.desc: High-quality leather boots, preferred by soldiers in a lord's army. Surprisingly durable and can withstand harsh weather with ease.

156.name: Boots of Strife
156.desc: Good quality shoes typically worn by elite warriors in long marches. A bit on the heavier side, but very very durable.

157.name: Heavy Plate Armor
157.desc: A huge piece of plate armor that usually signifies the wearer's knighthood.

158.name: Gladiator's Heavy Armor
158.desc: Heavy plate armor with engravings, adorned only to the best of gladiators.

159.name: Squire's Metal Helmet
159.desc: Helmet made for young aspiring knights in the making. The road ahead is hard, but scars are always the best teacher.

160.name: Field Knight Helm
160.desc: Metal battle helm made for mounted knights of an ambitious kingdom. This helm has accompanied knights to countless battles.

161.name: Greaves of the Exiled
161.desc: Plated foot armor of the ancient knights, who've been exiled far before the four kingdoms come into being.

162.name: Gladiator's Greaves
162.desc: Brass greaves adorned to renowned gladiators in times old.

163.name: Standard Wood Axe
163.desc: The well-balanced woodcutter's axe for harvesting various types of timber.

164.name: Standard Hammer
164.desc: The quintessential tool for quarriers and stoneworkers.

165.name: Standard Fishing Rod
165.desc: The well-crafted standard tool of seasoned fishermen.

166.name: Standard Pickaxe
166.desc: This standard mining pick excavates typical underground resources.

167.name: Standard Sickle
167.desc: The well-crafted standard tool for reaping any cultivated crops.

168.name: Standard Berry Shears
168.desc: The standard bramble shears used by seasoned berry gatherers.

169.name: Veteran Wood Axe
169.desc: Good quality veteran axe built for prolonged woodcutting.

170.name: Veteran Hammer
170.desc: This heavy and all-rounded hammer shatters boulders with ease.

171.name: Veteran Fishing Rod
171.desc: A hardy fishing rod for battling bigger freshwater prizes.

172.name: Veteran Pickaxe
172.desc: A sturdy pickaxe tempered for prolonged mineral extraction.

173.name: Veteran Sickle
173.desc: This sturdy veteran sickle deftly slices through dense mature wheat stalks.

174.name: Veteran Berry Shears
174.desc: Elegantly-patterned shears that's preferred by experience gatherers.

175.name: Fungus Growth
175.desc: Beneath the hard exoskeleton of Crabark hides a number of parasitic fungus.

176.name: Serpent Eye
176.desc: The golden eye of a great ancient predator.

177.name: Crystal Horn
177.desc: The large horn of giants and their ascendants. Originally made of ice, through ages it became so dense under pressure it crystallized.

178.name: Beastmen's Banner
178.desc: Honored war banner of beastmen origin. Crude, but a great symbol of power.

179.name: Greater Healing Potion
179.desc: An enhanced mixture that provides substantial healing power, favored by experienced adventurers.

180.name: Grand Healing Potion
180.desc: A potent blend that rapidly restores significant health, crafted by skilled alchemists.

181.name: Master Healing Potion
181.desc: An expertly crafted elixir that provides powerful healing.

182.name: Expert Wood Axe
182.desc: A precision-crafted axe that makes quick work of timber, reflecting years of woodcutting expertise.

183.name: Adept Wood Axe
183.desc: An advanced axe incorporating superior techniques that dramatically improves woodcutting efficiency.

184.name: Elite Wood Axe
184.desc: An exceptional axe that channels raw power into every swing, making short work of any timber.

185.name: Master Wood Axe
185.desc: A masterpiece of craftsmanship that turns felling trees into an art form.

186.name: Legendary Wood Axe
186.desc: A mythical axe whose origins are shrouded in mystery, capable of felling ancient trees with a single stroke.

187.name: Divine Wood Axe
187.desc: A sacred axe blessed by the forest gods, capable of harvesting wood with supernatural precision and power.

188.name: Expert Hammer
188.desc: A perfectly balanced hammer that efficiently breaks down stone with minimal effort.

189.name: Adept Hammer
189.desc: A sophisticated hammer design that breaks stone with remarkable precision and power.

190.name: Elite Hammer
190.desc: A premium hammer that pulverizes stone with astonishing efficiency and control.

191.name: Master Hammer
191.desc: A hammer of unparalleled quality that makes stone quarrying feel effortless.

192.name: Legendary Hammer
192.desc: A hammer of legend that can reshape entire quarries with thunderous power.

193.name: Divine Hammer
193.desc: A holy hammer that shapes stone with godlike authority and grace.

194.name: Expert Fishing Rod
194.desc: A professional-grade rod with enhanced sensitivity to detect even the subtlest nibbles.

195.name: Adept Fishing Rod
195.desc: A superior rod with specialized mechanics that increases successful catch rates significantly.

196.name: Elite Fishing Rod
196.desc: A top-tier rod that seems to attract fish with an almost magical efficiency.

197.name: Master Fishing Rod
197.desc: An extraordinary rod that seems to be lighter than water itself.

198.name: Legendary Fishing Rod
198.desc: A fabled rod that attracts the most elusive catches with mysterious power.

199.name: Divine Fishing Rod
199.desc: A blessed rod that commands the respect of the ocean's mightiest inhabitants.

200.name: Expert Pickaxe
200.desc: A refined mining tool that extracts ore with increased precision and yield.

201.name: Adept Pickaxe
201.desc: A highly efficient mining tool that extracts ore with minimal waste and maximum yield.

202.name: Elite Pickaxe
202.desc: A superior mining tool that extracts precious ores with unprecedented precision.

203.name: Master Pickaxe
203.desc: A pinnacle of mining technology that extracts ore with supernatural efficiency.

204.name: Legendary Pickaxe
204.desc: A storied mining tool said to have unearthed the realm's greatest treasures.

205.name: Divine Pickaxe
205.desc: A sacred mining tool that extracts ore with divine precision and boundless power.

206.name: Expert Sickle
206.desc: A masterfully crafted blade that swiftly harvests crops with exceptional accuracy.

207.name: Adept Sickle
207.desc: A refined harvesting blade that significantly reduces the time needed to gather crops.

208.name: Elite Sickle
208.desc: An outstanding harvesting tool that sweeps through fields with remarkable speed and grace.

209.name: Master Sickle
209.desc: A harvesting tool of such quality that entire fields bow before its blade.

210.name: Legendary Sickle
210.desc: A legendary blade that harvests with such speed it appears to bend time itself.

211.name: Divine Sickle
211.desc: A blessed harvesting blade that turns fields of crops into bountiful offerings.

212.name: Expert Berry Shears
212.desc: Finely-tuned shears that carefully select and harvest only the ripest berries.

213.name: Adept Berry Shears
213.desc: Precision-engineered shears that expertly harvest berries while preserving the bush's vitality.

214.name: Elite Berry Shears
214.desc: Superior shears that harvest berries with perfect precision and exceptional speed.

215.name: Master Berry Shears
215.desc: Shears of such precision they can harvest the most delicate berries without disturbing a single leaf.

216.name: Legendary Berry Shears
216.desc: Mythical shears whose harvests are said to yield berries of extraordinary quality.

217.name: Divine Berry Shears
217.desc: Sacred shears that harvest with divine grace, blessing each berry with otherworldly perfection.

218.name: Gravekeeper's Axe
218.desc: This runed axe glows in the night, once used by gravekeepers to grant peace by severing souls from remains.

219.name: Greataxe of Night
219.desc: Massive axe from the twilit realm of Misthaven, its umbral blade cleaving both flesh and shadow with each catastrophic strike.

220.name: Paladin's Crossbow
220.desc: Sacred crossbow blessed to strike true, repelling evil as bolt meets unholy flesh.

221.name: Phantom's String
221.desc: Ethereal bowstring from the realm beyond, granting supernatural accuracy and distance.

222.name: Ashfang Twins
222.desc: Each wicked edge leaving a scorched trail of holy retribution.

223.name: Azurefang Daggers
223.desc: Tapping into forbidden magics, shredding armor and unraveling reality itself.

224.name: Pyreborn Lance
224.desc: Fearsome longspear used by Sunscar's elite desert warriors to sweep aside any who stand in their path.

225.name: Voidflame Pike
225.desc: Massive lance of the wild beastmasters, channeling the ferocity of nature's mightiest beasts.

226.name: Nightbloom Scepter
226.desc: Staff resonating with innate magical energies, enhancing a wizard's arcane precision and focus.

227.name: Glacial Warden
227.desc: Frostbitten staff from Everfrost's glacial mages, its frozen spiral matrix amplifying their icy incantations.

228.name: Solarbane Edge
228.desc: Elegant yet deadly sword favored by Sylvanreach's deadliest warriors, each cleave puncturing even the toughest plate.

229.name: Greatsword of Elphmar
229.desc: Legendary warblade named for the elven hero Elphmar, keen enough to part a drake's scales.

230.name: Paladin's Shield
230.desc: Radiant holy shield bearing the sacred oath, warded against corruption and turning aside mortal blows.

231.name: Serpent's Round Shield
231.desc: Serpentine shield with hypnotic coils deflecting both blades and hostile magics with each sinuous curve.

232.name: Pilgrim's Hood
232.desc: Simple yet durable cloth cowl granting resilience and stealth on the open road to those of faith.

233.name: Vagabond's Hood
233.desc: Weathered adventurer's hood concealing the hardened features of those who have walked the loneliest paths.

234.name: Elite Tracker's Sandals
234.desc: Silent sandals, leaving no trail while swiftly tracking even the wariest quarry.

235.name: Boots of the Noble
235.desc: Polished cloth boots adorned with rank and status, projecting an aura of leadership and command.

236.name: Robe of the Ranger
236.desc: Lightweight arborweave robe granting agility and attunement with nature's secluded woodlands.

237.name: Astrologer's Attire
237.desc: Robes imbued with celestial portents. Traditionally it enhances divination and aid cosmic attunement.

238.name: Hunter's Leather Hood
238.desc: Supple hood drawn over the face, aiding in stealth and shielding against foul aromas of the hunt.

239.name: Warrior's Winter Helm
239.desc: Fur helmet for fending off winter's chill and sharpened blades in equal measure.

240.name: Reinforced Winter Boots
240.desc: Insulated boots reinforced with steel plates and fur lining, protecting the wearer from both deadly blows and bitter cold.

241.name: Merchant's Prized Boots
241.desc: Impeccably maintained boots lined with soft and premium leather, found on the corpse of an unknown merchant.

242.name: Fallen Beast Armor
242.desc: Armor adorned to warriors that have felled beastmen. It enchants the wearer with bestial vigor.

243.name: Ancient Sentinel Armor
243.desc: Enchanted armor of an ancient order in Sylvanreach, allowing attunement with nature's primal forces.

244.name: Gladiator's Battle Helm
244.desc: Fearsome gladiator's helm of gleaming steel, designed to intimidate before the killing blow.

245.name: Paladin's Helmet
245.desc: Ornate reinforced helmet inlaid with holy wards and blessings of the Platinum Order.

246.name: Deserted Knight's Boots
246.desc: Footplates from the armor of a long-dead knight, abandoned and now claimed as bounty.

247.name: Metal Boots of Valor
247.desc: Burnished steel sabatons emblazoned with the crest of heroism and bravery unmatched.

248.name: Blue Steel Armor
248.desc: Masterfully crafted full plate of swirling blue steel, deflecting blows as deftly as any mage's deflection ward.

249.name: Armor of Glory
249.desc: Gleaming gold-inlaid plate armor of a legendary champion, a mantle of inspiration to any who wear it.

250.name: Green Tongue
250.desc: A vibrant, fleshy organ pulsating with nature's energy.

251.name: Auroral Gem
251.desc: Formed within the Prismdeer's majestic antlers, these radiant gemstones capture the essence of celestial auroras.

252.name: Darkbloom
252.desc: A deadly black flower growing out of Misthaven's toxic creatures, with even a single petal containing potent venom.

253.name: Ancient Core
253.desc: A pulsing source of raw magic and power, this primordial energy core once powered ancient golem guardians.

254.name: Cold Bone
254.desc: Infused with intense frost from surviving brutal winters, these perpetually frozen bones are as hard as steel.

255.name: Oracle Shard
255.desc: Ethereal crystalline fragments attuned to the flow of fate and time.

256.name: Storm Wool
256.desc: Electrified strands of wool conducting raw lightning energy.

257.name: Primitive Claws
257.desc: Honed into blade-like spikes, these claws are meant to combat much bigger enemies. Just who are the Ravagers fighting?

258.name: Orb of the Forest Soul
258.desc: The Forest had a soul once, and a name. These are the nature's fragments of that long-gone era.

259.name: Orb of the Deep
259.desc: The Formless One drowned deep below, yet never died. These are the dark fragments of the long-gone era.

260.name: Orb of Unending Frost
260.desc: Each fracture is an opening. Ice in Everfrost rarely fractures, yet they melt. These are the cold fragments of that long-gone era.

261.name: Orb of Cataclysm
261.desc: Fire changes. Lands shift. Yet Sunscar remain. These are the fiery fragments of that long-gone era.

262.name: Dawnbringer
262.desc: An ancient sword so old it is said to have witnessed the dawn of human history. Who could have forged this though, if it existed before the age of man?

263.name: Wolf Song
263.desc: A magical staff that does not resonate with normal incantations in the human tongue.

264.name: The Key of Night
264.desc: This ancient weapon was never intended to be used in combat, but nevertheless deadly. It's as dark as the night sky.

265.name: Spear of Omen
265.desc: A spear so dense in rare metals that it does not melt in human-made forges, no matter the heat. Said to be usable only in the direst of times.

266.name: Work Horse
266.desc: A friendly and loyal companion that will stay with you through thick and thin in this adventure.

267.name: Capybara
267.desc: A guardian spirit of gentle strength, the Ancient Capybara carries the memory of the four kingdoms and walks with the calm of a thousand seasons.

268.name: Moripuru
268.desc: This green slime is commonly found in lush jungles.

269.name: Poipuru
269.desc: This poisonous slime naturally feeds on toxic matter.

270.name: Fuyupuru
270.desc: This ice-cold slime can freeze attackers with its exterior.

271.name: Pyropuru
271.desc: This slime radiates heat intense enough to melt steel.

272.name: Gobblekin
272.desc: A small, mischievous jungle goblin that's fast and nimble.

273.name: Screechit
273.desc: A swift, bat-winged squirrel that delivers quick, precise attacks.

274.name: Snow Rabbit
274.desc: This white-furred creature is extremely quick.

275.name: Flaming Fox
275.desc: The red fox breaths fire hot enough to burn any village down.

276.name: Ignis
276.desc: One of the mightiest dragons to ever existed. Ignis is the name.

277.name: Togepuru
277.desc: This slime creature had consumed thorny vines.

278.name: Kiripuru
278.desc: This slime creature is both more toxic, and harder to spot.

279.name: Koripuru
279.desc: This slime creature can conjure large ice spikes from its exterior.

280.name: Kazanpuru
280.desc: This slime creature can burst volcanic matter far from where it stands.

281.name: Petalflare
281.desc: This plant can use its colorful petals to release noxious powder.

282.name: Leafdrake
282.desc: A gentle dinosaur that secretes toxic poison to ward off predators.

283.name: Crabark
283.desc: A tree-crab hybrid with enormous claws and crushing strength.

284.name: Mycofiend
284.desc: A hulking fungal horror with a massive crimson mushroom cap.

285.name: Basilisk
285.desc: A massive, sinuous basilisk with venomous fangs and armored scales.

286.name: Mist Wyvern
286.desc: A wyvern that can seamlessly materialize from coastal fogs.

287.name: Snowzard
287.desc: A reptilian warrior with crystalline icy frills and a massive frozen spear.

288.name: Glaciewyrm
288.desc: A small-sized frost dragon soaring on crystalline wings.

289.name: Frost Graloch
289.desc: An ancient, towering behemoth cloaked in shaggy white fur.

290.name: Cinderwing
290.desc: A blazing, ruby-winged moth wreathed in sharp horns.

291.name: Calderatops
291.desc: A huge bull of molten rock and brimstone.

292.name: Dymryn Warrior
292.desc: The Dymryn warriors are among the most ferocious in the wilds.

293.name: Verdant Drake
293.desc: This creature's keen predatory instincts makes it a fearsome hunter.

294.name: Prismdeer
294.desc: A mystical deer whose majestic antlers shimmer with auroral colors.

295.name: Murklurker
295.desc: This feral beast stalks through the fog banks with surprising stealth.

296.name: Ancient Golem
296.desc: A mysterious stone construct from a forgotten age.

297.name: Lizard Champion
297.desc: A battle-hardened commander of the Snowzards.

298.name: Crystal Oracle
298.desc: An enigmatic being of pure frost magic that glides through Everfrost.

299.name: Voltex
299.desc: This sheep wanders the deserts, trailing electricity through its wool.

300.name: Ravager
300.desc: A fearsome predator that's fast, cunning and deadly.

301.name: Elder Behemoth
301.desc: An ancient beast encrusted in jagged shards of everlasting ice.

302.name: Vinethorn Drake
302.desc: A stealthy, serpentine predator covered in razor-sharp thorns.

303.name: Faylinn
303.desc: Your sweet and trustworthy partner in any adventure.

304.name: Liliana
304.desc: A young villager that tries her best to help everyone in need.

305.name: Maeve
305.desc: The classy and kind citizen of the misty kingdom. She knows everyone.

306.name: Marina
306.desc: Don't be fooled by her kind looks, she's one of Everfrost's best trackers.

307.name: Ayesha
307.desc: Ayesha is highly intelligent and caring, despite her rough upbringing.

308.name: Haines
308.desc: A veteran hunter and soldier, Haines is incredibly resourceful.

309.name: Lara
309.desc: Liliana's little sister has tremendous hidden potential as a sorcerer.

310.name: Duval
310.desc: Despite being a little weird, Duval is the mightiest knight in Misthaven.

311.name: Chione
311.desc: A genius and the youngest member of Everfrost's court sorcerers.

312.name: Hilathe
312.desc: A smart and quick-witted treasure hunter and adventurer.

313.name: Fiery Hellion
313.desc: An amorphous conflagration of blazing fire and smoldering rock.

314.name: Fathomspawn
314.desc: An otherworldly elemental of tentacles and bioluminescent ichor.

315.name: Storm Wraith
315.desc: A sentient maelstrom of swirling shadow and twisting storm.

316.name: Sylvia
316.desc: The ancient elven sorcerer that's renowned across the realm.

317.name: Hazel
317.desc: Hazel Thornweaver is a witch that has mastered magical harmonics.

318.name: Raena
318.desc: Chione's close friend and a talented magic user.

319.name: Kestrel
319.desc: A trusted member of the Cartographer's Guild in Sunscar.

320.name: Goopie Puru
320.desc: This virulent mass of acidic sludge corrodes anything in its path.

321.name: Jiggly Puru
321.desc: This rare species of slime emanates dangerously noxious fumes.

322.name: Slushy Puru
322.desc: A semi-frozen slime that managed to live for a hundred years.

323.name: Yippee Puru
323.desc: Nothing dares to touch this molten menace of a slime.

324.name: Waraxe of Frenzy
324.desc: A brutal axe that pulses with chaotic energy, driving its wielder into a whirlwind of unstoppable carnage.

325.name: Lionsnare
325.desc: A bow strung with the sinew of ancient beasts, said to bring down even the fiercest prey with a single shot.

326.name: Ruptured Twins
326.desc: A pair of daggers cursed and bound by blood, feeding off the fury of battle and striking with eerie precision.

327.name: Spear of Blazing Fury
327.desc: Forged in the heart of a fallen star, this spear blazes with searing wrath, leaving scorched trails in its wake.

328.name: Staff of Adoration
328.desc: An elegant staff imbued with celestial charm, weaving spells that enthrall as much as they destroy.

329.name: Meteoric Katana
329.desc: This blade, born of the heavens, cuts through armor and air alike with meteoric grace and lethal clarity.

330.name: Mirror Shield
330.desc: Forged from polished aetherglass, this shield reflects not only blows but the dark intent behind them.

331.name: Robe of the Royal Assassin
331.desc: Woven from shadows and silken betrayal, this robe grants its wearer an almost spectral presence.

332.name: Boots of the Royal Assassin
332.desc: Silent as midnight wind, these boots carry their master across rooftops and through bloodied halls unseen.

333.name: Mask of the Royal Assassin
333.desc: Veiled in mystery, this mask conceals all emotion and reveals nothing but the intent to kill.

334.name: Mistborn's Leather Armor
334.desc: Crafted in the fog-cloaked wilds, this armor slips through the senses like a phantom mist.

335.name: Mistborn's Boots
335.desc: These boots leave no trace, stepping as if upon fog, favored by those who walk where no trail dares linger.

336.name: Mistborn's Helm
336.desc: A helm etched with runes of silence, worn by those who vanish before the echo of battle fades.

337.name: Kingsguard's Heavy Armor
337.desc: A suit of valor-steeped steel, once donned by the royal vanguard who stood against a thousand foes.

338.name: Kingsguard's Metal Boots
338.desc: Each step in these iron-forged boots resounds with duty, echoing the march of kings' most loyal defenders.

339.name: Kingsguard's War Helmet
339.desc: This crowned helm bears the scars of war and the gaze of unwavering honor beneath its steel brow.

340.name: The Beholder
340.desc: A crimson staff crowned with a serpent’s eye, said to pierce illusions and channel forgotten arcane fury.

341.name: Scaled Armor of Kalyndra
341.desc: Forged from the Great Serpent’s back, this armor bends like leather but deflects blades like steel.

342.name: Boots of the Great Serpent
342.desc: Lined with scaled hide and silent as a stalking serpent, these boots carry their wearer with eerie grace.

343.name: Helm of the Great Serpent
343.desc: Shaped from Kalyndra’s crown, this helm sharpens the senses and imbues its bearer with an aura of primal dread.

344.name: Essence of Stillness
344.desc: A glowing orb, pulsing like a heartbeat in the snow. It holds the Capybara’s patience and watchfulness.

345.name: Essence of Flow
345.desc: A wisp of energy that dances and swirls. It holds the Capybara’s adaptability and inner strength.

346.name: Essence of Flame
346.desc: A burning core of golden-red light. It holds the Capybara’s courage and unwavering will.

347.name: Essence of Harmony
347.desc: A green core infused with natural energy. It holds the Capybara’s bond with the world and its tranquil wisdom.

348.name: Venombloom Petal
348.desc: A rare, thorned petal infused with corrosive nectar, used in potent poisons and nature-based enchantments.

349.name: Phantom Waterglide
349.desc: A ribbon of living water that never dries. This material is prized by alchemists for elemental rituals.

350.name: Fractured Heartshard
350.desc: This frozen and pulsating crystal is said to be the frozen heartbeat of the mountain itself.

351.name: Molten Core
351.desc: A searing-hot ember encased in obsidian that burns and gnaws forever, unless sealed in enchanted stone.

352.name: Eye of Kalyndra
352.desc: A glowing, slit-pupiled gem, said to grant visions of truths best left unseen.

353.name: Kalyndra's Ridgeplate
353.desc: A thick, flexible scale-plated fragment from the serpent’s back. Tougher than tempered steel, but much lighter.

354.name: Fangroot
354.desc: A long, dark fang with faint green veins running along its edge.

355.name: Heart of Venom
355.desc: A pulsing core-like fragment, tinted deep purple and green.

356.name: Strength Cheese
356.desc: Aged cheese infused with herbs from Everfrost, known to bolster physical strength.

357.name: Poison Cheese
357.desc: Decrease stats of an enemy temporarily.

358.name: Exp Cheese
358.desc: Increase experience gain for a limited time.

359.name: Destruction Meteorite
359.desc: A fragment of a fallen star, said to enhance destructive powers.

360.name: Destruction Meteorite
360.desc: A fragment of a fallen star, said to enhance destructive powers.
